name: OR_CASE
description: The OR_CASE table contains OR management system case records.

columns.name: OR_CASE_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the procedural case record.

columns.name: CASE_NAME
columns.description: The name of the surgical case record.

columns.name: SURGERY_DATE
columns.description: The date on which the surgery is scheduled to take place.

columns.name: CASE_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description: The case type category number for the case. Example case types include elective and emergency. This column is frequently used to link to ZC_OR_CASE_TYPE.

columns.name: CASE_CLASS_C_NAME
columns.description: The case classification category number for the case. Example case types include elective and trauma. This column is frequently used to link to ZC_OR_CASE_CLASS.

columns.name: PAT_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the patient associated with the procedural case record.

columns.name: PAT_AGE
columns.description: The age of the patient associated with the surgical case.

columns.name: PAT_CLASS_C_NAME
columns.description: The category value which represents the type of the patient associated with the surgical case record.

columns.name: SERVICE_C_NAME
columns.description: The category value which identifies the surgical service of the case record.

columns.name: NUM_OF_PANELS
columns.description: The total number of procedure panels in the surgical case record. A panel is a grouping of surgical procedures performed together.

columns.name: EXP_DATE
columns.description: The date on which this surgical case expires. The case should be scheduled on or before this date.

columns.name: REQUESTED_BY
columns.description: The name of the person who requested that the surgical case be created.

columns.name: SETUP_OFFSET
columns.description: The amount of time in minutes required to set up at the beginning of the case.

columns.name: CLEANUP_OFFSET
columns.description: The amount of time in minutes required to clean up at the end of the case.

columns.name: TOTAL_TIME_NEEDED
columns.description: The total amount of time required to perform the case.

columns.name: REFERRING_PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the physician who referred the patient associated with the case.

columns.name: OR_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the room the case is scheduled to be performed. This column is frequently used to link to CLARITY_SER.

columns.name: LOC_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the location where the procedure is scheduled to be performed. This column is frequently used to link to CLARITY_LOC.

columns.name: PRIORITY_C_NAME
columns.description: The category value which represents the priority of the case.

columns.name: ADD_ON_CASE_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether a case is an add-on. Y indicates that the add-on check box is checked, and this is done manually by the scheduler for cases that have been scheduled after the usual scheduling window is closed. N or null indicates that the case is not an add-on.

columns.name: SCHED_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number for the case scheduling status.

columns.name: CASE_PROGRESS_C_NAME
columns.description: The category value which represents the current progress status of the case as it proceeds.

columns.name: CANCEL_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number of the most recent reason the case was canceled or removed from the schedule. This column will remain populated even if the case is put back on the schedule. This column is frequently used to link to ZC_OR_CANCEL_RSN.

columns.name: CANCEL_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the user who most recently canceled the case or removed it from the schedule. This column will remain populated even if the case is put back on the schedule. This column is frequently used to link to CLARITY_EMP.

columns.name: TIME_SCHEDULED
columns.description: The date and time at which the case is scheduled to be performed on the surgery date.

columns.name: VOID_REASON_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number for the reason the case was voided. This column is frequently used to link to ZC_OR_VOID_REASON.

columns.name: CANCEL_CHKIN_RSN_C_NAME
columns.description: The category value which represents the reason the check-in was canceled.

columns.name: PATIENT_ESCORT
columns.description: The person escorting the patient for the surgery. This is a free text value.

columns.name: PANEL1_START_AT
columns.description: Indicates at what time within the case panel 1 should begin. This is measured in minutes relative to the beginning of the case.

columns.name: PANEL1_LENGTH
columns.description: The total amount of time required for panel 1 to be performed. This includes the times of all the procedures within the panel.

columns.name: PANEL2_START_AT
columns.description: Indicates at what time within the case panel 2 should begin. This is measured in minutes relative to the beginning of the case.

columns.name: PANEL2_LENGTH
columns.description: The total amount of time required for panel 2 to be performed. This includes the times of all the procedures within the panel.

columns.name: PANEL3_START_AT
columns.description: Indicates at what time within the case panel 3 should begin. This is measured in minutes relative to the beginning of the case.

columns.name: PANEL3_LENGTH
columns.description: The total amount of time required for panel 3 to be performed. This includes the times of all the procedures within the panel.

columns.name: PANEL4_START_AT
columns.description: Indicates at what time within the case panel 4 should begin. This is measured in minutes relative to the beginning of the case.

columns.name: PANEL4_LENGTH
columns.description: The total amount of time required for panel 4 to be performed. This includes the times of all the procedures within the panel.

columns.name: PANEL5_START_AT
columns.description: Indicates at what time within the case panel 5 should begin. This is measured in minutes relative to the beginning of the case.

columns.name: PANEL5_LENGTH
columns.description: The total amount of time required for panel 5 to be performed. This includes the times of all the procedures within the panel.

columns.name: REC_CREATE_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the user who created the case.

columns.name: ADT_CSN
columns.description: Contact serial number for an Admission Discharge Transfer (ADT) admit contact.

columns.name: CASE_REQST_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the user who placed the web request.

columns.name: SHUFFLE_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the user who placed the case in the shuffle depot.

columns.name: PAT_LEVEL_C_NAME
columns.description: The category value representing the patient level in the case.

columns.name: PAIN_MGMT_C_NAME
columns.description: The category value which represents the patient's participation in pain management.

columns.name: ADMIT_DATE
columns.description: The date on which the patient was admitted.

columns.name: RESEARCH_IND_C_NAME
columns.description: The category value which represents the candidacy of the case for research.

columns.name: ADMIT_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description: The category value which indicates the admit source for the patient's stay.

columns.name: ADMITTING_SRVC_C_NAME
columns.description: The category value which indicates the admitting service for the patient's stay.

columns.name: ADMITTING_PHYS_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the admitting physician.

columns.name: ADMIT_BED_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description: The category value which indicates the admitting bed type.

columns.name: ADD_ON_DATE
columns.description: The date the case first shows up as an add-on.

columns.name: MODIFIED_CASE_LEN
columns.description: The length of the case, in minutes, if it has been shortened or lengthened.

columns.name: PAT_TOTAL_TIME
columns.description: The amount of time in minutes for which the patient is present.

columns.name: BUMPED_CASE_YN
columns.description: Yes/No flag indicating whether or not the case has been bumped.

columns.name: CASE_ACCEPTED_YN
columns.description: Yes/No flag indicating whether or not the case was accepted in Case Entry.

columns.name: PROJ_START_INST
columns.description: The projected date and time for the start of this case.

columns.name: PROJ_END_INST
columns.description: The projected date and time for the end of this case.

columns.name: REAL_TIME_OR_ID
columns.description: Store the surgery case's operating room according to the log.

columns.name: PANEL1_IS_COMB_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the time for Panel 1 is the procedures' combination time from procedure time averaging. Y indicates that the time is from the procedures' combination procedure time average; N indicates it is not. A null value indicates the panel was not added in the case.

columns.name: PANEL2_IS_COMB_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the time for Panel 2 is the procedures' combination time from procedure time averaging. Y indicates that the time is from the procedures' combination procedure time average; N indicates it is not. A null value indicates the panel was not added in the case.

columns.name: PANEL3_IS_COMB_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the time for Panel 3 is the procedures' combination time from procedure time averaging. Y indicates that the time is from the procedures' combination procedure time average; N indicates it is not. A null value indicates the panel was not added in the case.

columns.name: PANEL4_IS_COMB_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the time for Panel 4 is the procedures' combination time from procedure time averaging. Y indicates that the time is from the procedures' combination procedure time average; N indicates it is not. A null value indicates the panel was not added in the case.

columns.name: PANEL5_IS_COMB_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the time for Panel 5 is the procedures' combination time from procedure time averaging. Y indicates that the time is from the procedures' combination procedure time average; N indicates it is not. A null value indicates the panel was not added in the case.

columns.name: PANEL1_DEF_LEN
columns.description: The panel length defaulted by the system for Panel 1.

columns.name: PANEL2_DEF_LEN
columns.description: The panel length defaulted by the system for Panel 2.

columns.name: PANEL3_DEF_LEN
columns.description: The panel length defaulted by the system for Panel 3.

columns.name: PANEL4_DEF_LEN
columns.description: The panel length defaulted by the system for Panel 4.

columns.name: PANEL5_DEF_LEN
columns.description: The panel length defaulted by the system for Panel 5.

columns.name: PANEL1_LEN_MOD_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the length of the panel 1 was modified by the user.

columns.name: PANEL2_LEN_MOD_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the length of the panel 2 was modified by the user.

columns.name: PANEL3_LEN_MOD_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the length of the panel 3 was modified by the user.

columns.name: PANEL4_LEN_MOD_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the length of the panel 4 was modified by the user.

columns.name: PANEL5_LEN_MOD_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the length of the panel 5 was modified by the user.

columns.name: REQUESTED_DATE
columns.description: The preferred date requested for this case.

columns.name: REQUESTED_TIME
columns.description: The time (of the day) requested for this case.

columns.name: EXP_ADM_DTE_OFFSET
columns.description: Stores the number of days prior to the day of surgery, the patient is expected to be admitted.

columns.name: CASE_VERIFIED_YN
columns.description: Has the case been verified?

columns.name: PAT_ALLERGIES_YN
columns.description: Indicates if the patient has Allergies.

columns.name: PAT_HEALTH_ISSUE_YN
columns.description: Indicates if patient has health issues.

columns.name: FILMS_FOR_SURGER_YN
columns.description: Indicates if the patient is bringing films to surgery.

columns.name: PREOP_VISIT_NEED_YN
columns.description: Indicates if a PreOp Visit is needed.

columns.name: PREOP_VISIT_COMP_YN
columns.description: Indicates if PreOp Visit has been completed.

columns.name: LOG_ID
columns.description: This columns stores the log ID for this case.

columns.name: CASE_ACCEPT_NEED_YN
columns.description: Stores whether the case accept programming point needs to be fired. Used when a case was created from a order to fire the accept programming points before the case can be scheduled.

columns.name: IS_CLINICAL_TRL_YN
columns.description: Indicates if the case is a clinical trial case.

columns.name: PEND_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description: The status of a pending web request.

columns.name: POSTOP_DEST_C_NAME
columns.description: The patient's post-operative destination.

columns.name: TRANSLATOR_C_NAME
columns.description: The category value of the language of the case translator.

columns.name: PTA_LAST_UPD_DATE
columns.description: Stores the date the procedure time was last updated in the case

columns.name: CASE_BEGIN_INSTANT
columns.description: Stores the datetime instant in which the case began.

columns.name: CASE_END_INSTANT
columns.description: Stores the datetime instant in which the case ended.

columns.name: MULT_PROC_COMP_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether there were multiple procedures used in calculation of procedure time for this case.

columns.name: USING_EAP_YN
columns.description: This item defines whether this case is using the Procedure master file (EAP) for scheduling procedures? Default value is 'No'.

columns.name: ANESTHESIA_C_NAME
columns.description: The anesthesia type category number for the case.

columns.name: CASE_SOURCE_DEPL_ID
columns.description: ID of the source deployment that created the case through cross deployment scheduling.

columns.name: PRIMARY_PHYSICIAN_ID
columns.description: The primary surgeon from panel 1 of the case, as scheduled. This column is frequently used to link to CLARITY_SER.
